Explanations about Options.-I(M):
Display all network addresses of the host. This option enumerates all configured
 addresses on all network interfaces. The loopback interface and IPv6 link-local
 addresses are omitted. Contrary to option -i, this option does not depend on name
 resolution. Do not make any assumptions about the order of the output.
Explanations about Options.-i(M):
Display the network address(es) of the host name. Note that this works only if the
 host name can be resolved. Avoid using this option; use hostname --all-ip-addresses
 instead.

Explanations about Options.-x(M):
Simplified reverse lookups, for mapping addresses to names. The addr is an IPv4
 address in dotted-decimal notation, or a colon-delimited IPv6 address. When the -x is
 used, there is no need to provide the name, class and type arguments. dig
 automatically performs a lookup for a name like 94.2.0.192.in-addr.arpa and sets the
 query type and class to PTR and IN respectively. IPv6 addresses are looked up using
 nibble format under the IP6.ARPA domain.
